org.haldean.chopper.pilot
Class Navigation

java.lang.Object
  org.haldean.chopper.pilot.Navigation
All Implemented Interfaces:
Constants, Receivable
public class Navigation
extends Object
implements Constants, Receivable

Handles Navigation routines; calculates next target velocity vector.

May send the following messages to registered Receivables:

 NAV:AUTOTASK:<travel_plan_index>:<serialized_NavTask>
May receive the following messages from Chopper components: 
 NAV:
     SET:
         MANUAL
         AUTOPILOT
         AUTOTASK:<travel_plan_index>:<serialized_NavTask>
     GET:AUTOTASKS
 CSYS:
      NOCONN
      LOWPOWER

Author:
Benjamin Bardin

Method Detail

autoPilot

public void autoPilot(boolean onoff)
Changes autopilot status (on or off)

Parameters:
onoff - The new autopilot status

getPersistentThreadInstance

public PersistentThread getPersistentThreadInstance()
Obtains the thread that runs the Navigation routines. On first call to this method, the PersistentThread is created. But since two or more instances of Navigation should not be run concurrently, subsequent calls to this method return only that first thread.

Returns:
The PersistentThread that runs Navigation.

getTarget

public double[] getTarget()
                   throws IllegalAccessException
Obtains current navigation target vector. If the data is locked, immediately throws an exception.

Returns:
A new array containing the navigation target vector.
Throws:
IllegalAccessException - If the data is currently locked.

getTarget

public void getTarget(double[] expectedValues)
Writes current navigation target vector into supplied array. If the data is locked, immediately returns with neither data update nor warning.

Parameters:
expectedValues - The array in which to write the vector--must be at least of length 4.

getTasks

public String[] getTasks()
Obtains all scheduled flight plans

Returns:
An array of strings representing all flight plans (serialized form)
